question: The Québec Act of 1774:
possible_answers: A. allowed religious freedom for Catholics
B. is one of the constitutional foundations of Canada
C. permitted Catholics to hold public office
explanatory_sentence: One of the constitutional foundations of Canada, the Québec Act accommodated the principles of British institutions to the reality of the province. It allowed religious freedom for Catholics and permitted them to hold public office, a practice not then allowed in Britain.
